The effective monthly rate is 9/12 = 0.75%, and we can calculate the present value
of $5,000 three years (36 months) from now as 5,000 / (1.0075)36 = $3,820.74.
Alternatively, since the EAR is 1.007512 - 1 = 0.093807, we can calculate the
present value by discounting 5,000 at the EAR for three years. 5,000 / 1.0938073 =
$3,820.74, which is the same result.
